properties.areaDesc: Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northwest Blue Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 9:47PM PST until January 28 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...HIGH ELEVATION SNOW TONIGHT THROUGH TOMORROW...

.Storm system currently impacting the region is bringing rain and
high elevation snow this evening and will continue into tomorrow
before winding down tomorrow evening. Snow levels will generally
fluctuate between 4000 to 5000 ft, except in central Washington,
where trapped colder air will help keep snow levels down to around
3000 feet through tomorrow morning. This will bring impactful
snow from near Cle Elem up towards Snoqualmie Pass. Gusty winds
could lead to areas of blowing and drifting snow in the northern
Blues.

* WHAT...Snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations
of 4 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. In Oregon,
Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon.

* WHEN...From now through 8 PM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET
